Database¶

rixarag uses chromadb. This module adds wrapper functions to interact with chroma.

Documentation¶

class rixarag.database.GPUEmbeddings(model, normalize_embeddings: bool = True)¶

SentenceTransformer with automatic choice of GPU or CPU

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_is_protocol = False¶
encode(input)¶
class rixarag.database.RagDB(*args, **kwargs)¶

Singleton class to manage the RagDB client and SentenceTransformer embedding function

_instance = None¶
rixarag.database.add_processed_chunks(processed_chunks, collection_name)¶

Add processed chunks to the ChromaDB

Assumes a processed chunk is a dictionary with the following keys: - text: the text of the chunk - metadata: a dictionary with metadata about the chunk

Parameters:

  • processed_chunks – a list of processed chunks

  • collection_name – the name of the collection to add the chunks to

rixarag.database.delete_collection(collection_name)¶

Delete a collection from the ChromaDB. Not reversible!

rixarag.database.get_all_elements(collection_name)¶

Get all elements in a collection

rixarag.database.get_chroma_client()¶

Get the ChromaDB client

rixarag.database.get_element_count(collection_name)¶

Get the number of elements in a collection

rixarag.database.get_random_elements(count=5, collection='default')¶

Get random elements from the ChromaDB

Parameters:

  • count – the number of elements to return

  • collection_name – the name of the collection to query

rixarag.database.list_collections(raw=False)¶

List all collections in the db

rixarag.database.load_model()¶

Just load the model. Useful to reserve GPU memory :return:

rixarag.database.purge()¶

Reset the ChromaDB. Not reversible!

rixarag.database.query(query_str: str, collection='default', n_results: int = 5, max_distance=0.75, kwargs: Dict[str, Any] = {})¶

Query the ChromaDB

Parameters:

  • query – the query string

  • collection – the name of the collection to query

  • n_results – the number of results to return

  • max_distance – Entries with distances larger than this will be filtered out

  • kwargs – additional keyword arguments to pass to the query function of chromadb

rixarag.database.query_by_metadata(query_dict, collection='default', count: int = 5, **kwargs)¶

Query the ChromaDB for entries where metadata[key] == value

For more advanced queries use the chroma client and the where statement directly See here https://docs.trychroma.com/guides#using-where-filters

Parameters:

  • query_dict – a dictionary of key-value pairs to query for. E.g. if you search for images use {“type”: “image”} and if you search for images from the document with id 123 use {“document_id”: 123, “type”: “image”}

  • collection – the name of the collection to query

  • n_results – the number of results to return

rixarag.database.query_inverted(query_str: str, collection='default', n_results: int | None = None, max_distance=0.75, kwargs: Dict[str, Any] = {}, maximum_chars=4000)¶

Returns same content as query. However query returns a dict with lists as values, this returns a list of dicts Also this supports maximum_chars as an alternative to n_results.

It also flattens the metadatas into the main dict and renames elements to be more intuitive :param query_str: :param collection: :param n_results: Maximum number of results to return. If specified with maximum_chars, this will set an alternative upper limit. :param max_distance: :param maximum_chars: When maximum chars is set it will return the minimum set of chunks that have in total less than maximum_chars characters. :param kwargs: :return:
